poem:
**A Concession Stated**

Upon the floor, words unravel,  
£300 million woven through time's breath,  
Calls ignored, hands extend—  
but who gathers the thread?  
Evening shadows stretch,  
Labour's soft murmur scattered.  
An echo in corridors,  
where unanswered voices  
echo amidst  
the paper tide.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Liz Kendall ignores call from Labour MP for welfare bill to be withdrawn – as it happened 6.23pm BST Early evening summary Liz Kendall, the work and pensions secretary, has told MPS that the government is spending another £300m on measures to get sick and disabled people back into work. (See 3.10pm.) This is the latest concession to Labour rebels, and Kendall set it out in a statement to MPs lasting almost two hours. But". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
